case_vignette:
A 10-year-old boy is brought to a pediatric clinic by his parents with pain and weakness in the lower extremities for the past 3 weeks. The patient’s mother says that he has been active until the weakness and pain started during his soccer practice sessions. He says he also experiences muscle cramps, especially at night. His mother adds that, recently, the patient constantly wakes up in the night to urinate and is noticeably thirsty most of the time. The patient denies any recent history of trauma to his legs. His vaccinations are up to date and his family history is unremarkable. His vital signs are within normal limits. Physical examination is unremarkable. Laboratory findings are shown below:
Laboratory test
Serum potassium 3.3 mEq/L
Serum magnesium  1.3 mEq/L
Serum chloride 101 mEq/L
pH 7.50
Pco2 38 mm Hg
HCO3- 20 mEq/L
Po2 88 mm Hg
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Renal and Genitourinary System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've had pain and weakness in my legs for the past 3 weeks, and I get muscle cramps, especially at night.
How old are you?
I'm 10 years old.
Have you had any changes in your urination or thirst lately?
Yes, I've been waking up a lot at night to pee and I'm really thirsty most of the time.
Has anyone in your family ever had diabetes or kidney problems?
My family history doesn't have anything remarkable in it.
Are you taking any medications or have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions in the past?
No, I'm not on any medications and I haven't been diagnosed with any medical conditions.
**Final Diagnosis:** Type 1 Diabetes
